brief: Automate LiveOps event scheduling and reward distribution for multiplayer games.

sections.problem_statement: Game developers face challenges in managing LiveOps events for multiplayer games, which often require manual scheduling and reward distribution. This process is time-consuming, error-prone, and lacks scalability. Automating these tasks would significantly improve efficiency, reduce human error, and allow for more frequent and complex events, ultimately enhancing player engagement and retention.

goals_and_success_metrics.success_metric: Reduce manual scheduling time by 90% within 3 months of implementation
Achieve 99.9% accuracy in reward distribution within 1 month of launch
Enable 50% more LiveOps events per month compared to manual process
Increase daily active users by 20% within 6 months of full implementation

user_stories.story: I want to set up recurring LiveOps events with custom parameters so that I can save time and ensure consistency
I want to easily modify event schedules and rewards based on player feedback so that I can quickly respond to community needs
I want to participate in frequent, varied LiveOps events so that I can earn rewards and stay engaged with the game
I want to access analytics on event performance so that I can make data-driven decisions for future events

constraints: Must integrate with existing game backend systems
Needs to support multiple game titles and platforms
Must comply with data protection regulations (GDPR, CCPA)
Should handle high concurrent user loads during peak event times
Must provide audit trails for all automated actions

sections.hypothesis: Automating LiveOps event scheduling will increase player engagement by 20%
sections.rationale: Regular, well-timed events keep players interested and active in the game. Automation ensures consistency and optimal timing based on player activity patterns.
sections.test: Implement automated scheduling for half of the player base and compare engagement metrics (daily active users, session length, retention) with the manually scheduled control group over a 3-month period.

sections.hypothesis: Automated reward distribution based on player behavior will improve in-game economy balance by 15%
sections.rationale: Dynamic reward allocation can adjust to player progression and spending habits, preventing inflation or deflation of in-game resources.
sections.test: Deploy automated reward distribution to a subset of players and monitor key economic indicators (resource scarcity, market prices, player satisfaction) against the control group for 2 months.

sections.hypothesis: Integrating machine learning into LiveOps automation will increase revenue per player by 10%
sections.rationale: ML algorithms can identify optimal event timing and personalized rewards for individual players, maximizing engagement and monetization opportunities.
sections.test: Implement ML-driven LiveOps for a segment of players and compare ARPU (Average Revenue Per User) with the standard automated system over a 4-month period.

sections.hypothesis: Automated LiveOps will reduce operational costs by 30%
sections.rationale: Automation reduces the need for manual intervention, allowing the team to focus on content creation and strategic planning rather than day-to-day operations.
sections.test: Track time spent on LiveOps tasks before and after automation implementation, and calculate the cost savings based on employee hours and resources allocated.
